4.56.text: These people are amongst the greatest quiz players in Britain.

9.92.text: Together, they make up the Eggheads,

11.88.text: arguably the most formidable quiz team in the country.

17.40.text: The question is, can they be beaten?

23.20.text: Welcome to Eggheads, the show where a team of five quiz Challengers

26.92.text: pit their wits against possibly the greatest quiz team in Britain.

30.36.text: They are the Eggheads. Had a good day so far?

33.04.text:
- So far. 
- So far. 
- So far. 
- See if we can put an end to that.

36.52.text: Taking on the might of our quiz Goliaths today

42.16.text: are all associated with their local choir,

44.12.text: which is based in the villages of Cottingham and Middleton.

49.32.text: Hello, my name is Mary and I'm a retired nurse.

53.12.text: Hi, I'm Sue and I'm an NHS consultant.

- So, Mary, team, welcome. 
- Thank you. 
- Good to see you.

88.36.text:

- 2010. 
- 2010.

110.68.text: as Debbie is a music teacher and teaches in schools as well,

- We could sing something that we use to warm up.

125.28.text: # What shall we do with the drunken sailor

127.44.text: # What shall we do with the drunken sailor?

144.76.text:
- # Hooray and up she rises 
- Drunken sailor

146.84.text:
- # Hooray and up she rises 
- Drunken sailor

161.04.text: up for grabs for our Challengers, as you know.

163.20.text: If they fail to defeat the Eggheads,

164.92.text: the prize money rolls over to our next show.

167.48.text: So, Valley Voice, the Eggheads have won the last four games.

170.72.text: They're on a bit of a run,

172.48.text: so £5,000 says you can't beat them.

175.20.text:
- Would you like to try and stop the run now? 
- Yep. 
- Good.

183.76.text:

- Horehound I've never come across. 
- No, nor hornblende.

1551.76.text: It's just an odd spelling. It's an odd spelling to put.

1556.28.text:
- I think we'll have to go... 
- Yeah. 
- ..for houndstooth, yeah.

1559.84.text: We're not at all certain but we'll go for houndstooth, Jeremy.

1562.64.text: Houndstooth. Let's check it with the Eggheads. Do you know?

1565.76.text: I think it might be horehound.

1567.40.text: I would have gone for houndstooth

1568.92.text: cos I know it's a plant but...

1574.52.text: They used to use it as a cough medicine.

1577.44.text: Honey and horehound was a big thing in the 15th century,

1580.88.text:
- a physicians' thing. 
- OK. Eggheads, to take the lead.

1585.52.text: Edward Stanley, who served three times as UK Prime Minister,

1595.40.text:
- Derby. 
- It was Derby. 
- Derby's the one who served three terms.

1601.28.text: OK, he was Earl of Derby.

1604.08.text: Derby is correct. Good solid play from the Eggheads.

1608.76.text: too much yet, but let's get this right to stay in.

1612.84.text: Hopefully, they get theirs wrong, then all to play for.

1617.36.text: The town of Masham in the Yorkshire Dales

1620.60.text: is particularly associated with making which of these products?

1628.92.text:
- How can you make apples? 
- Yeah. 
- You grow apples. Um...

1634.40.text: Beer? Well, haven't our lads gone on a tour

1637.96.text: of most of the breweries in the UK?

1641.36.text: And I've not heard them mention Masham.

1647.92.text: What do you think? Should we go for chocolate?

1649.96.text:
- Shall we go for chocolate? 
- OK. 
- Yeah? 
- Yeah.

1652.56.text: We're going to go for chocolate, Jeremy.

1654.64.text: OK, chocolate is your answer. If you've got this right, we play on.

1657.56.text: If it is wrong, it is the end of the contest.

1659.72.text: Let me ask the Eggheads whether you know.

1661.76.text:
- I think... 
- Barry, it's you. 
- I think it must be beer.

1664.44.text:
- Home of the Black Sheep Brewery, Masham. 
- Yes.

1666.48.text: I'm sorry to say the answer is beer,

1668.32.text: so we have to tell the Eggheads, congratulations, you have won.

1678.00.text:
- Now, you can blame husbands and partners for that. 
- I think so.

1681.32.text: I think it's their fault. It is THEIR fault.

1683.60.text:
- The one brewery they don't visit! 
- Exactly.

1686.24.text:
- The Ramblers have done it again. 
- Yeah. 
- Oh, dear.

1689.28.text: Thank you very much for playing.

1691.16.text: It's great to see your team and brilliant to have the song earlier.

1694.36.text: Commiserations, Valley Voice. The Eggheads have done

1698.56.text: and they still reign supreme over Quizland.

1700.84.text: I'm afraid you won't be going home with the £5,000,

1703.36.text: so the money rolls over to our next show. Eggheads, well done.

1707.08.text: You're starting to get a bit of your gumption back, I think,

1710.16.text: and I'm wondering who's ever going to win.

1712.04.text: Join us next time to see if a new team of Challengers

1715.20.text: have the brains to defeat this lot.

1717.44.text: £6,000 is on the table. Until then, goodbye.
